content: maybe pepsi was inspired by michael jackson’s “heal the world” video (and say what you want, people, i love michael forever). except mj’s video had children playing and giving armed soldiers flowers in order to bring everyone together. so pepsi just replaced “children” with “kendall jenner” and “flowers” with “pepsi.” and i note that a little blond girl is the most prominent child to give the soldier a flower, dammit mj. this video always makes me tear up a little, partly because it’s so ridiculously naively optimistic, and this will never, ever happen with human beings because we are terrible. yet, it *should* be as easy as “let’s stop killing each other because of children and, like, decency and stuff.” but no, we’re still killing children with, say, sarin gas. humans suck. (ot: i don’t know where this video is supposed to take place… it was made in 1991, so maybe in some recently devastated former eastern bloc country? but then asian and african children show up in the same place at the end so… it’s weird). but whatever. i dig the symbolism and hope in this video, but always found it a little naive that mj didn’t realize a lot of those soldiers would have just shot those children.  maybe pepsi was emulating michael because they felt bad for setting his hair on fire that one time.
